issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: {{WebHdfsFileSystem#runWithRetry}} uses reflection to prepend the remote host to the exception.  While it preserves the original stacktrace, it omits the original cause which complicates debugging.
fields.summary: WebHdfsFileSystem exceptions should retain the caused by exception

comments.body:
Thanks Daryn for filing the bug.
Uploaded a simple patch to retain the exception cause if it exists.
Thanks [~hanishakoneru] for taking it up. Instead of setting cause as exception message we can call {{newIoe.initCause(ioe.getCause())}} to set the cause in newly created exception.
Agree with Nanda.  That's exactly what I intended to do but don't have the cycles to write a test (which is also missing here).

Thanks [~nandakumar131] and [~daryn] for reviewing the patch.
Updated patch v02 to address the comment and also include a test case.

[~hanishakoneru], thanks for updating the patch. LGTM.

NITs:
TestWebHDFS
line:1502 Since {{webIn.read()}} throws IOException and not DummyThrowable, we can change the fail message to {{Read should have thrown IOException.}}
line:1503 we can catch IOException instead of Exception here.

Thanks for the review, [~nandakumar131].
Addressed yours comments in patch v03.
Test failures are unrelated and pass locally for me.

[~hanishakoneru], thanks for updating the patch.
LGTM, +1 (non-binding).

+1 from me also. Thanks for the reviews [~nandakumar131].

[~daryn], does this look fine to you?

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #13229 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/13229/])
